column5: Crispy, cheesy quesadillas come together in just minutes! To make these a more complete meal, we add mushrooms to the mix. They make a quick snack, or a full meal with a salad or soup on the side.

A Mezze Platter is an easy, fun, and family-friendly dinner! Use the ingredients listed as a starting point with room to swap in other dips, vegetables, or fruits depending on what’s in season and what you have on hand.

Cacio e pepe is the most divine pasta dish made with simple, high quality ingredients. Tender noodles tossed in a two-cheese blend and a hint of cream ensure luscious forkfuls. Freshly cracked black pepper adds tiny spicy bursts of flavor with each bite.

Who knew stale bread could be so good? This Chicken Panzanella Salad with bread, tomatoes, and shredded chicken is the perfect dinner for a hot summer night. Easy, delicious, and good enough to eat on its own!
These chicken skillet enchiladas are easy to make and ready in 30 minutes. They also use only one pan and are great to double and freeze for a meal down the road!

Want a great burger cooked on the stovetop? These double-stacked cheeseburgers are what your cravings desire: thin, tender patties, melty cheese, and a generous amount of secret sauce. Don't forget a napkin!

It's all in the seasoning for these skillet shrimp fajitas! Toss shrimp in some chili powder and red pepper flakes, and then quickly cook them in a skillet with some veggies. Better-than-restaurant quality fajitas are yours in no time!
This Homemade Pepperoni Pizza has everything you want—a great crust, gooey cheese, and tons of pepperoni. The secret to great pepperoni flavor? Hide extra under the cheese! Who needs delivery?

column1: Pan-Seared Pork Chops with Garlic and Greens
column5: These pan-seared pork chops with a side of garlicky greens are the perfect one-pan meal. It's ready in about half an hour, too! P.S. Brining makes all the difference with  making juicy chops, so don't skip it.

column1: Pan Seared Scallops with Sweet Corn and Chiles
column5: Pan seared scallops nestled in a bed of sweet corn and poblano chiles—perfect for sultry summer nights. Invite some friends over, pour a glass of crisp white wine, and watch the fireflies.
These Garlic Herb Steak Bites can be whatever you want. Appetizer? Serve them with toothpicks. Dinner entrée? Serve them with rice or potatoes! Kids love 'em, too!

column1: Grilled Salmon with Cucumber Mango Salsa
column5: This quick and easy grilled salmon is kissed with lime and chili pepper, then topped with a cool, refreshing, colorful, and utterly delicious cucumber mango salsa. It’s okay. Go ahead and do a happy dance—you just won summer!

Add a little Argentinian flair to pan-seared skirt steak with a simple avocado chimichurri sauce. The lean and beefy cut cooks in just minutes in a sizzling hot skillet. It’s a quick dinner that will take your taste buds on a South American adventure!

column1: 4 Skillet Chicken Freezer Meals for Busy Weeknights
column5: Busy weeks call for freezer meals and skillet dinners! Southwestern, Italian, Herbes de Provence, and Chinese 5-Spice—each one of these skillet chicken dinner is packed with vegetables and on the table in about 35 minutes!

Skirt steak is a meat lover’s dream! This thin, quick-cooking cut is loaded with beefy flavor and stays tender and juicy after briefly searing in a hot pan. Learn how to cook skirt steak with finesse with these simple tips.

Whether we're talking a casual movie night with the family or Super Bowl Sunday, these Loaded Sheet Pan Nachos are ready to party! They come together quickly and easily, and are so much fun to each straight from the pan.

This Classic Tomato Soup is rich with a velvety texture. It’s easy to make with canned tomatoes, and perfectly suited for all of your grilled cheese dipping needs. Better than a can of Campbell's and just about as easy!

column1: Quick and Easy Pan-Fried Flank Steak
column5: A quick and easy way of cooking lean flank steak on the stovetop.
English Muffin Tuna Melts! If you've got the fixins for tuna salad, some cheese, and a few English Muffins, you've got dinner. With any luck, you've got dinner your kids will love, too.

column1: Pasta with Spinach, Artichokes and Ricotta
column5: There are never enough pasta recipes, right? Here's a quick one that combines creamy ricotta, spinach, and artichoke hearts, topped a crunchy mix of breadcrumbs and almonds.
This easy stovetop Chicken Tikka Masala tastes just like your favorite Indian take-out and is ready in under an hour. Leftovers are even better the next day!

column1: Puerto Rican Salmorejo (Stewed Crab and Tomatoes with Rice)
column5: Puerto Rican Salmorejo de Jueyes is a treat for anyone who loves crab! Traditionally an all-day family affair, buying lump crab meat means you can have this hearty stew and rice on the table in about a half an hour.

London Broil - Top round steak, seasoned with dry mustard, salt, pepper, and rubbed with butter, pan fried to brown, then finished in the oven if necessary with thicker cuts.

Quick and easy shrimp scampi. Shrimp sautéed in easy scampi sauce with garlic, butter, olive oil, and white wine, tossed with red pepper flakes and parsley.

Hamburger and Macaroni! Others call it goulash or even American chop suey. Whatever you call it, it's great for a midweek meal. Browned ground beef cooked in a tomato onion sauce, mixed in with elbow macaroni. So good!

column5: Pasta with a tomato sauce with Italian turkey sausage and smoked mozzarella cheese.

Crispy fried catfish fillets coated in a seasoned cornmeal crust!
A classic Italian pasta sauce based on pantry items such as olives, capers, anchovies and canned tomatoes.

Rich, meaty Bolognese Sauce is easy to make and can be on the table in 35 minutes. Use it to top pasta noodles, or layer in lasagna. It’s freezer-friendly too. Make a double or triple batch to enjoy all winter long!
Petrale sole fillets, dusted in flour, sautéed in olive oil and served with a sauce of white wine, lemon juice, capers, parsley and butter.
Classic Steak au Poivre, or steak with a creamy peppercorn sauce

Turkey Stroganoff recipe made with turkey leftovers, mushrooms, thyme and sour cream.

Broccoli, first blanched, then sautéed briefly with sliced grilled chicken, toasted almonds, sesame oil, and red chile flakes.

Sautéed mushrooms on toast and topped with a fried egg make a satisfying meat-free meal on days when you need something easy. Make it for breakfast, lunch, or dinner — it's good any time of day!

column1: Quick Sausage, Kale, and Crouton Sauté from Smitten Kitchen Every Day
column5: Try this Quick Sausage, Kale, and Crouton Sauté from Deb Perelman's new cookbook, Smitten Kitchen Every Day! It's a fast meal that's easy to adapt and is always a hit at dinner time.

column1: Soba Noodle Soup with Chicken and Bok Choy
column5: This soba noodle soup with chicken and baby bok choy is speedy comfort food! Seasoned with ginger, lime, scallions, and herbs. A true 30-minute meal.

column1: Tuna Burgers with Dill Olive Mayo
column5: Tuna burgers to the rescue when you need dinner in a hurry and you're drawing a blank! Grab a can of tuna from the cupboard and you're mostly done. Some dill olive mayo takes it over the top!

column1: Pork Chops with Ginger Pear Sauce
column5: Pan-seared pork chops with a sweet and sour pear and ginger sauce. Perfect for the fall, cooks up in minutes and only uses one pot!

column1: Pasta with Turkey Meatballs and Roasted Vegetables
column5: Pasta dinner with turkey meatballs and roasted vegetables. Toss with olive oil, lemon juice, and parsley. Quick, easy, and satisfying. Ready in about 30 minutes.

column1: Baked Salmon with Avocado Mango Salsa
column5: Oven-baked salmon fillets served with avocado, mango, chile, lime salsa.
Chicken thighs with spicy chermoula sauce, a North African parsley and cilantro pesto.
Baked salmon provencal recipe with a sauce of fresh tomatoes, fresh chopped herbs, a few shallots, lemon juice, balsamic and olive oil.
Pork tenderloin medallions, sauteed in butter and served with a caper mustard cream sauce.

column1: Chicken, Mushrooms, and Tomatoes with Port Wine
column5: Pan-cooked boneless, skinless, chicken breasts, with mushrooms, fresh tomatoes, and port wine.
Pasta with shrimp, artichoke hearts, basil pesto, and peas. A great quick, pull-together meal.
This easy flounder with Parmesan breadcrumbs is the perfect vacation dinner. It's quick to make with shredded Parmesan Cheese & there's plenty for everyone. Cheesy breadcrumbs FTW!

column1: Spicy Garlic Shrimp with Coconut Rice
column5: Here's a classic recipe for Camarones al Ajillo, a.k.a. spicy garlic shrimp! The shrimp gets quickly sautéed with garlic and jalapeno, then mixed with some coconut rice. Serve with coconut rice for a full meal.
These Vietnamese Sticky Chicken Skewers balance all the flavors—sweet, salty, sour, and savory! Great as a party appetizer or fun weeknight meal.

column1: Pasta with Roasted Tomatoes and Creamy Herb Cashew Sauce
column5: Pasta? Check. Roasted tomatoes? Check. Creamy vegan cashew sauce? Absolutely CHECK! This recipe is so simple, but it delivers big on both flavor and creaminess. Make the cream sauce ahead of time and dinner is ready in no time.

column1: Savory Dutch Baby Pancake with Salmon and Fried Egg
column5: From its dramatic puffy rise to its whole grain flavor, this Dutch baby pancake is a winner. Top it with smoked salmon and fried eggs and serve it for brunch — or for dinner!
A peach-avocado salsa is a delicious complement to this grilled salmon. A grill pan ensures the salmon stays crispy throughout the cooking process without sticking to the grill. Winner!
Quick and simple vegetarian dinner of grains, mushrooms, and spinach. Great for lunch, too! 30-minute one-pot meal.
Spicy grilled chicken tacos! Quick marinade, then grill. Ready in about 30 minutes. Great for a quick weeknight dinner, backyard cookouts, and tailgate parties.

column1: Fresh Salmon Cakes with Spicy Mayo
column5: Fish cakes made with fresh-cooked salmon! So incredibly tender and flavorful, especially with spicy mayo sauce! Great way to use up leftover salmon, too.
This Chinese smashed cucumber salad with bits of shredded chicken is so fast and easy. Great for hot summer nights.

column1: How to Do a New England Clambake at Home
column5: You don't need to be in Cape Cod in order to make this clambake. Just follow these instructions for a one-pot clambake, New England style, in the comfort of your own home.
Quick and easy, sautéed zucchini noodles tossed with pesto, chicken and tomatoes.
Turkey tacos recipe with cranberry salsa! Another great way to use up Thanksgiving turkey leftovers.
A favorite dish for Chinese New Year, shrimp stir-fried in a sauce of ketchup, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, and broth, and served on a bed of lettuce.
Simple and easy cheese tacos recipe, made with corn tortillas, fried in a little butter, folded over grated cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese.  Also known as quesadillas.
Juicy, grilled hamburger recipe seasoned with fresh rosemary and A1 sauce and topped with lettuce, tomato, onions, and avocado.

column1: Angel Hair Pasta with Quick Cherry Tomato Sauce
column5: This Angel Hair Pasta with Cherry Tomato Sauce is so quick and easy! Ready in about 20 minutes flat, and SO GOOD! Best with fresh summer cherry tomatoes.

column1: Chicken with Goat Cheese and Arugula
column5: Skinless, boneless chicken breasts, pounded thin, wrapped around an arugula and goat cheese stuffing and roasted.

column1: Moroccan-Spiced Sweet Potato and Chickpea Stew
column5: Moroccan-spiced vegetable and chickpea stew seasoned with ras el hanout spice mix (cumin, coriander, ginger, and cinnamon). Vegan and gluten-free. 30-minute cooking time.

column1: Soba Noodle Bowls with Spinach and Poached Eggs
column5: EASY and FAST Soba Noodle Bowls. With spinach, poached eggs, and sesame seeds. 20 minutes to make.

column1: Baked Tilapia with Sun-dried Tomato Parmesan Crust
column5: Easy baked tilapia fillets with sun-dried tomato, Parmesan, breadcrumb crust, and optional berry sauce.
Chicken Mango Lettuce wraps are light and nourishing, made with stir fried chicken, shiitake mushrooms, and diced mango, served in wraps of lettuce!

column1: Crispy Curried Chicken Thighs with Wilted Greens
column5: Crispy curried chicken thighs! Serve with quick-sautéed onions and wilted greens. Easy 30 minute meal. Gluten-free and paleo.
Chicken with Creamy Cassis Sauce! Chicken breasts lightly sautéed and served with a sauce made with cream, white wine, and creme de cassis, a liqueur made from blackcurrants.

column1: Sesame Chicken Fingers with Spicy Orange Dipping Sauce
column5: Chicken fingers, tenders marinated in buttermilk, breaded with panko and sesame seeds, baked, served with spicy orange sauce
Citrus Pork with Egg Noodles is quick and easy, perfect for a midweek dinner! With strips of pork loin sautéed with cumin and garlic, served in a citrusy sauce with carrots and egg noodles.

column1: Lemony Spaghetti with Peas and Ricotta
column5: Lemony Spaghetti with Peas and Ricotta! Mix up your pasta night routine with this recipe! Comes together quickly with just a few ingredients.
Quick and easy miso glazed chicken wings, perfect for game day or a fun weeknight dinner!
Spicy ground pork with mango, almonds, and cilantro. Perfect over rice!
Easy Middle Eastern fattoush! Crispy pita chips, fresh vegetables, and a tangy dressing. 30 minutes.

column1: Chicken and Avocado Salad with Buttermilk Dressing
column5: This simple, satisfying salad is the perfect way to use up leftover chicken. Top it with a zingy buttermilk dressing and a wedge if garlicky toast!

column1: Flank Steak with Orange and Avocado Salsa
column5: Switch up your dinner routine this flank steak and citrus-avocado salsa! It's easy to make on the stovetop or on a grill, and feeds the whole family. Serve as tacos or over salad greens.

column1: Buffalo Cauliflower Tacos with Ranch Sauce
column5: These Buffalo Cauliflower Tacos are a great meat-free main—all the flavor of buffalo wings, but made with cauliflower! Top these easy tacos with vegan ranch dressing and serve.

column1: Whole Wheat Pasta with Kale Pesto
column5: This Whole Wheat Pasta with Kale Pesto is a quick and easy meatless dinner! Make your pesto with cashews for extra creaminess. Blanching the kale also helps keep the pesto green.

column1: Texas Stacked Enchiladas with Corn and Black Beans
column5: Think of these as a deconstructed enchilada: warm corn tortillas layered with sweet corn, black beans, cheese, and spicy salsa. They're quicker and easier than traditional enchiladas, great for a weeknight meal!

column1: Pork Chops with Sweet and Sour Sauce
column5: Quick and easy pork chops with a sweet and sour sauce made with red currant jelly and Dijon mustard. 25 minutes start to finish!
Chunks of swordfish sautéed with fresh tomatoes, smoked paprika and pine nuts.

column1: Grilled Fish Tacos with Strawberry Pineapple Salsa
column5: Grilled Fish Tacos topped with a sweet and tangy Strawberry Pineapple Salsa! This is the perfect summer meal: light, fresh, and fast. Great for a party.

column1: Spicy Grilled Turkey Burger with Coleslaw
column5: Spicy grilled turkey burger served with tomatoes, sweet pickles, and coleslaw.  Not your everyday turkey burger, these have fresh chives, bread crumbs, basil and Tabasco sauce.

column1: Chicken Marsala with Pancetta and Cream
column5: This Chicken Marsala is so creamy, and so good! Learn how to make Chicken Marsala with breaded chicken cutlets in a Marsala wine, pancetta, and cream sauce. The secret is in the pancetta!

Hot summer weather just begs for easy, fast meals on the grill, and this Salsa Verde Chicken is exactly that. With homemade or store-bought salsa verde, they require almost zero effort but deliver big flavor.

column1: One-Pan Roasted Harissa Salmon with Vegetables
column5: One-pan roasted salmon, rubbed with Moroccan harissa spice, roasted with green beans, bell peppers, and cherry tomatoes. Easy and elegant!

column1: Rosemary Chicken Skewers with Berry Sauce
column5: Marinated in rosemary, these sweet and savory grilled chicken skewers are served with a delicious blackberry sauce. How to make chicken skewers that are equally unexpected and delicious.
Delicious ginger chicken! Chicken strips, marinated in coriander and ginger, stir-fried with scallions and ginger, served mixed with mango chutney and topped with toasted almonds.

column1: Sautéed Shrimp with Tropical Fruit Salsa
column5: Sautéed shrimp topped with a mango pineapple kiwi salsa and toasted coconut flakes. 1 pot and takes only 25 minutes to make!

column1: Pasta with Artichoke Hearts, Sun Dried Tomatoes, and Toasted Almonds
column5: Fusilli pasta tossed with marinated artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, and toasted almonds.

column1: Quick Green Curry Chicken with Zucchini Noodles
column5: Quick Green Curry Chicken with Zucchini Noodles! Use store-bought green curry for a fast dinner and keep it light with zucchini noodles instead of rice noodles.

column1: Grilled Chicken Tarragon with Tomato Sauce
column5: Simple and easy, grilled chicken recipe, topped with a tomato tarragon sauce.

Skip take-out and make this Kung Pao Chicken at home! This spicy, sweet Chinese stir-fry is made with hot chilis, Szechwan peppercorns, garlic, ginger, and unsalted peanuts. Serve with rice for a weeknight meal.

column1: Pasta with Sausage, Tomatoes and Roasted Peppers
column5: Pasta tossed with Italian sausage, roasted red bell peppers, olives, capers, fresh tomato and basil

Taco Salad made with healthy ground turkey, black beans, and corn. Serve warm or cold over romaine lettuce with fresh tomatoes, avocados, and shredded cheese. Perfect for a mid-week meal or make-ahead lunch.

column1: Chicken Pasta with Thyme-Mint Cream Sauce
column5: Cubed chicken sautéed in olive oil, served with pasta in a creamy sauce infused with thyme, mint, and honey.

column1: Pasta with Roasted Cauliflower and Prosciutto
column5: Orecchiette pasta tossed with roasted cauliflower, roasted cherry tomatoes, prosciutto, arugula, and Parmesan.
QUICK and EASY steak salad with a light miso vinaigrette. Ready in 30 minutes, or make-ahead for an even quicker weekday meal. Gluten-free.
Three Teacup Chicken is so good! A classic Chinese chicken dish with ginger, garlic, scallions, and soy sauce. Quick and easy! Takes only 20 minutes to make. One Pot.

column1: Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Mozzarella, Red Peppers, and Arugula
column5: Ready to try a new kind of grilled cheese? This Grilled Cheese with Mozzarella, Roasted Red Peppers, and Arugula is sweet, peppery, and too tempting to pass up!
Fresh mussels steamed in tomato sauce and served over pasta is the ultimate comfort food! Luckily, fresh mussels are readily available these days AND they are easy to prepare.

column1: Sweet Corn and Goat Cheese Quesadillas
column5: Sweet corn! Zucchini! Goat cheese! Basil! Fold these up in a quesadilla, and you've got one quick dinner. If you need a super easy meal to make on a hot summer day, this is definitely it.
It's sweet corn season! Make the most of it with this sweet and creamy Sweet Corn Gnocchi Skillet. Fast, filling, and kid-friendly—it's a win for everyone!

column1: Easy Avocado and Black Bean Quesadillas
column5: Creamy avocados and savory black beans are a great match. Load them onto a quesadillas, add a mix of cheeses, and dinner is served in minutes! This is such an easy and kid-friendly weeknight dinner.
Crazy week? We hear you. Bookmark this round-up of easy 30-minute meals and you'll be set for those nights when dinner seems impossible.
Flatbread pizza made with naan is quick, easy, and ready in less than 20 minutes. This version is loaded with fresh vegetables and herbs, but you can add any toppings you want. The sky’s the limit!

This Easy Green Chicken Chili uses mild, roasted Hatch peppers and rotisserie chicken for a quick, delicious, kid-friendly soup. Use fresh-roasted, frozen, or jarred Hatch chiles. We love it topped with crispy tortilla chips and sliced avocado!
Hello, homemade Panko Fish Sticks! Say goodbye to soggy fish sticks from the freezer! These fish sticks are ready for the table in about 30 minutes and are sure to please the whole family.
These Vegan Sloppy Joes are made with green lentils and a spice blend so good you’ll be licking the plate. You won't miss the meat! Great make-ahead or freezer meal, too.

column1: Maria Lichty’s Pesto Havarti Mac and Cheese
column5: Mac and cheese goes green with this spinach and basil pesto from cookbook author Maria Lichty of Two Peas and Their Pod. Havarti adds a silky, creamy touch to this comfort food classic.
Finally! This Grilled Cheese BLT means you'll never have to choose between two delicious sandwiches for your lunch ever again. Have them both! Right now!

You don’t need to travel to Maryland for delicious, easy-to-make crab cakes. Make them in the comfort of your own home in about 30 minutes. Serve them on a bed of lettuce or a bun, just don’t forget the lemon wedges!

What about BBQ chicken for your next pizza?! This recipe uses leftover cooked chicken and balances sweetness with heat with a hickory BBQ sauce. Press the dough into the pan, add the toppings, and you're good to go!

column1: Steak Noodle Bowls with Miso-Lime Dressing
column5: Looking for a quick, healthy, and satisfying weeknight dinner or workday lunch? These steak noodle bowls are bursting with crunchy sugar snap peas and cucumbers then finished with a zippy miso-lime dressing. All this goodness in under 30 minutes.

column1: Orecchiette Pasta with Sausage and Kale
column5: This Sausage and Kale Orecchiette is a great weeknight meal. It uses just a few ingredients and can be made quickly. Great for kids, too!
Crispy, cheesy quesadillas come together in just minutes! To make these a more complete meal, we add mushrooms to the mix. They make a quick snack, or a full meal with a salad or soup on the side.

A Mezze Platter is an easy, fun, and family-friendly dinner! Use the ingredients listed as a starting point with room to swap in other dips, vegetables, or fruits depending on what’s in season and what you have on hand.

Cacio e pepe is the most divine pasta dish made with simple, high quality ingredients. Tender noodles tossed in a two-cheese blend and a hint of cream ensure luscious forkfuls. Freshly cracked black pepper adds tiny spicy bursts of flavor with each bite.

Who knew stale bread could be so good? This Chicken Panzanella Salad with bread, tomatoes, and shredded chicken is the perfect dinner for a hot summer night. Easy, delicious, and good enough to eat on its own!
These chicken skillet enchiladas are easy to make and ready in 30 minutes. They also use only one pan and are great to double and freeze for a meal down the road!

Want a great burger cooked on the stovetop? These double-stacked cheeseburgers are what your cravings desire: thin, tender patties, melty cheese, and a generous amount of secret sauce. Don't forget a napkin!

It's all in the seasoning for these skillet shrimp fajitas! Toss shrimp in some chili powder and red pepper flakes, and then quickly cook them in a skillet with some veggies. Better-than-restaurant quality fajitas are yours in no time!
This Homemade Pepperoni Pizza has everything you want—a great crust, gooey cheese, and tons of pepperoni. The secret to great pepperoni flavor? Hide extra under the cheese! Who needs delivery?

column1: Pan-Seared Pork Chops with Garlic and Greens
column5: These pan-seared pork chops with a side of garlicky greens are the perfect one-pan meal. It's ready in about half an hour, too! P.S. Brining makes all the difference with  making juicy chops, so don't skip it.

column1: Pan Seared Scallops with Sweet Corn and Chiles
column5: Pan seared scallops nestled in a bed of sweet corn and poblano chiles—perfect for sultry summer nights. Invite some friends over, pour a glass of crisp white wine, and watch the fireflies.
These Garlic Herb Steak Bites can be whatever you want. Appetizer? Serve them with toothpicks. Dinner entrée? Serve them with rice or potatoes! Kids love 'em, too!

column1: Grilled Salmon with Cucumber Mango Salsa
column5: This quick and easy grilled salmon is kissed with lime and chili pepper, then topped with a cool, refreshing, colorful, and utterly delicious cucumber mango salsa. It’s okay. Go ahead and do a happy dance—you just won summer!

Add a little Argentinian flair to pan-seared skirt steak with a simple avocado chimichurri sauce. The lean and beefy cut cooks in just minutes in a sizzling hot skillet. It’s a quick dinner that will take your taste buds on a South American adventure!

column1: 4 Skillet Chicken Freezer Meals for Busy Weeknights
column5: Busy weeks call for freezer meals and skillet dinners! Southwestern, Italian, Herbes de Provence, and Chinese 5-Spice—each one of these skillet chicken dinner is packed with vegetables and on the table in about 35 minutes!

Skirt steak is a meat lover’s dream! This thin, quick-cooking cut is loaded with beefy flavor and stays tender and juicy after briefly searing in a hot pan. Learn how to cook skirt steak with finesse with these simple tips.

Whether we're talking a casual movie night with the family or Super Bowl Sunday, these Loaded Sheet Pan Nachos are ready to party! They come together quickly and easily, and are so much fun to each straight from the pan.

This Classic Tomato Soup is rich with a velvety texture. It’s easy to make with canned tomatoes, and perfectly suited for all of your grilled cheese dipping needs. Better than a can of Campbell's and just about as easy!
